Subject: Unsuccessful removal of EndpointProtectorClient
Description: Dear Support Team, In July I reached out to you and requested for a script based removal tool that could have been used together with our MDM to properly remove Endpoint Protector client from non licensed macOS endpoints. Ticket number: !00D70091pB.!500Qk0COaMn Download link for removal tool: http://download.endpointprotector.com/Support_files/remove-epp_mac_nopwd.command.zip I have taken this script and added to Kandji, rolled it out to about 230 devices successfully. However it turns out that the client has never been removed from the targeted devices, remained installed. This is what the log file shows: • Executing Remove CoSoSys Endpoint Protector... • Exit code: 0 • Script results: • Removing Endpoint Protector from your system ... • The Endpoint Protector daemon is not running. • The Endpoint Protector launchd starter is not installed. • Executing: /usr/bin/kmutil showloaded • No variant specified, falling back to release • The kernel extension is not loaded. • Executing: /usr/bin/kmutil showloaded • No variant specified, falling back to release • The EPPUsbHelper kernel extension is not loaded. • Executing: /usr/bin/kmutil showloaded • No variant specified, falling back to release • The eppkauth extension is not loaded. • Startup item is not installed. • Startup item is not installed. • Configuration folder does not exist. • Shadowing folder does not exist. • Dashboard widget is not installed. • rm: /Applications/EndpointProtectorClient.app: is a directory • Restoring printing permissions ... • lpadmin: Printer name can only contain printable characters.
